body: For those watching at home, it looks like this didn't get flipped in Bazel 8.0.0.

@gregestren In light of https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/25123, I think that the `run_under` target should be configured for the exec platform of the `test` exec group, not the default exec group. Should we change that after that PR has been merged and before flipping this flag?

issue.title: Configure `--run_under` target for the test exec platform

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
With `--incompatible_bazel_test_exec_run_under`, the `--run_under` target should be configured for the execution platform of the test action, not the default execution platform of the test rule.

This is still not fully correct if `testing.ExecutionInfo` is used to specify an alternative test exec group, but that's a far more difficult change: it would potentially involve a split transition with one configuration for each exec group.

Work towards #23179

issue.title: [8.1.0] Configure `--run_under` target for the test exec platform

issue.body:
With `--incompatible_bazel_test_exec_run_under`, the `--run_under` target should be configured for the execution platform of the test action, not the default execution platform of the test rule.

This is still not fully correct if `testing.ExecutionInfo` is used to specify an alternative test exec group, but that's a far more difficult change: it would potentially involve a split transition with one configuration for each exec group.

Work towards #23179

Closes #25177.

issue.title: Flip `--incompatible_bazel_test_exec_run_under` for Bazel

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
RELNOTES[inc]: `--incompatible_bazel_test_exec_run_under` is now enabled by default, which means that the `--run_under` target in a `bazel test` invocation will be built for each test's execution platform.

Fixes #23179
